page.title: 06CHANGING LILLIESLEAF
page.content: THE{CHURCH}WAS ENLARGED CONSIDERABLY IN ABOUT 1880 AND THE APSE WAS BUILT ON JUST BEFORE WORLD WAR 1. UP TO ABOUT 1930 NONE OF THE HOUSES HAD WATER.YOU HAD TO GO AND FILL THE BUCKET OR CAN AT THE STAND PIPE.THEN IN THE 1930'S WATER WAS PUT IN AND IT WAS ONLY A COLD TAP AND A TOILET AND SINK.THEN AFTER WORLD WAR 2 ALL COTTAGES HAD HOT WATER AND TOILETS , BATH'S AND WASHHAND BASINS.THE WATER CAME FROM LINDEAN RESERVOIR.THE FARMS HAD TO RELY ON SPRINGS. ELECTRICITY CAME IN ABOUT 1951.BEFORE THEN IT WAS ALL OIL LAMPS AND CALOR GAS.THE LANDWARD AREA GOT ELECTRICITY IN ABOUT1956. {VISITORS}DIDN'T HAVE ANYWHERE TO STAY BUT THEY COULD HAVE SOMETHING TO EAT AT THE{CROSS KEYS}OR THERE WAS A TEAROOM AT THE BACK OF THE LITTLE SHOP OPPOSITE THE POLICE STATION.
